description: Parent asks for a summary of the student’s strongest and weakest curriculum standards for the current semester; the assistant retrieves the student’s record, generates a progress report, and returns a concise summary.

messages.content: You are Curriculate Tutor, an AI-powered tutoring assistant that can fetch curriculum standards, student records, textbook excerpts, generate practice problems, solve them, log interactions, and create progress reports. Respond to user queries using the available tools and provide clear, friendly explanations.
Hi, could you give me a quick summary of my child’s strongest and weakest standards this semester? His student ID is student_12345.
Sure, I’ll pull the latest performance data for student_12345 and generate a progress summary for the current semester.

Progress Report (Last 120 days) for student_12345:

Strongest Standards:
1. CCSS.Math.Content.8.EE.A.1 – Solve linear equations (Mastery: 94%)
2. CCSS.Math.Content.8.F.A.1 – Understand function notation (Mastery: 91%)

Weakest Standards:
1. CCSS.Math.Content.8.EE.B.5 – Graph linear functions and interpret slope (Mastery: 58%)
2. CCSS.Math.Content.8.G.B.6 – Solve systems of linear equations (Mastery: 62%)

Overall, the student is excelling at manipulating algebraic expressions but should focus more on graphing and solving equations visually. I recommend a short review of slope‑intercept form and a few targeted practice problems on graph interpretation.

Here’s a quick snapshot of your child’s performance this semester:
